title: NYTimes: US and Global News
description:
Discover original reporting and understand the events shaping the world in The New York Times app. Follow breaking news and get live updates. Watch news videos that provide context on top stories. Listen to news podcasts, culture podcasts, narrated articles and more. Access a range of coverage, including investigations, cultural commentary and analysis.

Download the app to enjoy all of The Times, all in one place: breaking news and in-depth reporting, plus games, recipes, audio journalism, product reviews, sports coverage and more.

BREAKING NEWS AND LIVE UPDATES
- Push notifications deliver the latest headlines and developing stories as they happen.
- Your daily news app that helps you stay informed as news breaks.
- Add widgets and custom alerts to keep up with the latest world news.

ORIGINAL REPORTING AND IN-DEPTH ANALYSIS
- Read, watch and listen to investigative reporting and insights.
- Access global news from 1,700 Times journalists reporting from 150 countries.
- Explore complex stories brought to life through data and visual journalism.

NEWS VIDEOS
- Watch videos featuring reporters, critics and other experts.
- Get closer to the story with videos across news and culture.
- Understand breaking news, top stories, culture reporting and more, in video.

INFORMED AUDIO NEWS
- Listen to a variety of audio journalism, including podcasts and narrated articles.
- Tune in to daily podcasts like “The Daily” and “The Headlines.”

ARTS, SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY AND LIFESTYLE COVERAGE
- Discover reporting across arts, culture, fashion, travel and more.
- Stay informed on topics like technology, science and health.
- Explore culture with podcasts like “Modern Love” and “The Interview.”

SAVE, FOLLOW AND PERSONALIZE
- Easily save and access articles on topics you care about.
- See what’s new for you with personalized recommendations based on your tastes and reading history.

WORD, VISUAL AND NUMBER GAMES
- Unwind with daily games like the Crossword, Wordle, Connections, the Mini, Spelling Bee and Sudoku.

INSPIRING RECIPES
- Explore recipe ideas for easy weeknight dinners, holiday showstoppers and more.

COMMUNITY CONVERSATIONS
- Engage with Times reporters and readers in our moderated comments section. 
- Subscribers can share 10 articles per month with anyone.

DIGITAL SUBSCRIPTIONS
Enjoy everything we offer with a New York Times All Access subscription, which includes unlimited access to:
— Investigations, culture and analysis from News
— Word, visual and number puzzles from Games
— Recipes, videos, advice and inspiration from Cooking
— Independent product reviews from Wirecutter
— In-depth, personalized sports coverage from The Athletic

BY DOWNLOADING THE NEW YORK TIMES APP, you agree to:
• The automatic renewal terms stated above.
• The New York Times Privacy Policy: https://www.nytimes.com/privacy/privacy-policy
• The New York Times Cookie Policy: https://www.nytimes.com/privacy/cookie-policy
• The New York Times California Privacy Notices: http://www.nytimes.com/privacy/california-notice
• The New York Times Terms of Service: https://www.nytimes.com/content/help/rights/terms/terms-of-service.html

* Promotional offers for new subscribers only. Prices shown are in U.S. dollars. Other restrictions apply.

summary: Follow the latest world news, headlines and developing stories with live alerts.

scraped_reviews.content: I like the NYT, but I do not like this app. 3 GB of background data in one month (and this must be almost entirely during my commute, because I am always on WiFi at home and work, and have no reception in either) - needless and wasteful. Other news apps manage the same functionality without even a quarter of that data with both foreground and background combined.

Long time digital subscriber, and usually happy with the app - til now. Latest update made the homepage "Today" news section take 30 seconds to a solid minute to load/refresh, and since much of the time I'm in a hurry and just trying to catch latest headlines this is very annoying. The absolute slowest news app I use, which shouldn't be the case with a paying digital subscription.

Too many videos. However - I am a paid subscriber, and I pay to read the work of the amazing journalist - not to have autoplay of b-roll of shelves or whatever playing in the background. I sincerely hope NYT adds some kind of a 'text only' option. The last article I tried to read was terrible - literally two sentences of text, boxed in white, while most of the screen was taken up by an unstoppable autoplaying video.

Updated review, Oct 7, 2025. The app works fine and is well designed for the most part, but I've noticed one annoying bug the last few months. Sometimes an article will freeze for a few seconds, then I'll be taken out of the article completely and returned to the home page. The other day this happened 3 or 4 times in the course of reading a long article! Seems like maybe when the home page auto-refreshes, the app is forced to go back to the home page? Uninstall/reinstall doesn't help.

I have subscribed to the NYT for years, the push to upgrade has become so intrusive that every time I try to access the website that I have paid to do so, the hurdles of offers to upgrade to this or that section that had been formerly included takes upwards of ten minutes to navigate before I can actually read what I've paid to be able to do. I'm considering cancelling my subscription as it's no longer worth the time & money to try & read what I've already paid for

The news and app are good except for the ridiculous 2.1GB of background data used by the app for no reason. Even with settings turned to data saving in the app this app continues to burn through data more than any other app on my phone. Utterly ridiculous and I have no idea what they're doing. It's a HUGE detractor for me as when I travel I don't always have unlimited data.

I keep trying the app every year or so. It's just not as good as a browser. Scrolling is still glitchy. Getting back to the home page is sometimes multiple clicks. There are sections that are missing (eg, in the browser I can go to Sports, then go to "Tennis", or in the Well section I can go to "Mind" or "Family"). I'll stick with chrome for now.

Doesn't work anymore. Sometime around late October this app basically stopped working for me. It loads slowly, always freezes, articles do not open. It has become useless to me. I'm none too happy about it either, as I used to read it all day, whenever I needed a break. I use the inferior mobile site now. I run one version behind the current version of Android. Pixel 2XL. Tried deleting the app, and sending feedback to the devs. My phone has several free GB available. Please fix the app!

This app is really wonky. I tap on an article, and it takes me to a totally different one, often one I read earlier in the day. This happens about 3 out of 5 times. Usually I can find the one I want again, but not always. So crazy. Two weeks in a row I try to read articles from The Weekender and the links don't work. This week there is a brief error message saying it couldn't be opened for each article I tried.

I have over 300 apps on my tablet. This is by far the worst. Scrolling through articles is jumpy and unpredictable. Intrusive ads open in front of the text of articles as I am reading it. Page load times are incredibly long, ten or fifteen seconds is not uncommon, even though my internet connection is fast and strong. Grey bars flash in and out intruding on the articles. It often crashes five times while reading the paper once. The support team when contacted always blames the customer. They ignore what you say making everything my fault. If you read other reviews you will see I am not alone. This is a great newspaper, but the app is the worst.

11/2/24 Now, there is another failure. The tab default tab is always Games, not Top Stories. Home always goes to Games, not the last destination, which is the one I want. There is no way to refresh or jump to the reliably to Top Stories. Terrible. I am missing the ability to navigate and am spending too much effort to access what I want find.

I don't like the changes they made to the app. I thought the old version was more than fine. My least favorite change is I can no longer read articles in the horizontal position. Another major issue is with push notifications. Half of them don't lead to the article. A tip for users is to save the article and a lot of times it will actually save it. I do like that the app includes recently viewed.

good interface, easy to read. App doesn't crash. But I wish they would do a better job separating NYT Cooking from the regular food category. It is not included in the regular subscription, so why link cooking articles inside a regular food and dining article? I read an article to the end and I was interested in the content, but it ended abruptly with a link to a NYT Cooking recipe (recipe wasn't disclosed in regular article)

Top Stories don't load. Wrote to support and they said do a force stop, which works. But who wants to do that everytime they open an app? Out of the 56 apps I have on my phone this is the one that works the worst. Ironically, it's the one I pay the most for (via a digital NYT subscription). I'm giving it another week or two and then will cancel my subscription if no fix is released.

Saw a good deal on a subscription so I subscribed. Didn't want automatic renewal at 9x the price, so I followed the instructions to cancel. Throughout the process, it was clearly stated that I would keep access until the end of the first year. My purchase history shows that I still have access for another year. But nope, I lost access the next day and a rep confirmed this. Huge waste of time.

When clicking on notifications, between 30-50% of the time, the article I want to see fails to load and I get the front page of the app. Then, when I go to hunt for the article I wanted to read, I cannot find it in my tabs. Other than that though, great app. Please make Night Mode a standard feature and make it AMOLED black, not grey.

Almost unusable with the Pop Up Ads. There seems to be an onslaught of McDonald's Pop ads lately. They appear every 30 seconds to 1 minute. The ads are full page and interrupt whatever you may be reading. In order to close the ad, you have to click on a tiny X in the top corner. It is almost impossible to hit the X and you wind up opening the McDonald's site. I have tried everything I know to do, clearing cache, deleting browsing data, even removing and reinstalling the app. Nothing helps.

Somebody broke the app! Was there just an update? I've noticed over the past few days that not all articles will load, and the site is constantly refreshing. Lately it's been hit or miss whether an article would load, but the number of articles I can actually read had been diminishing every day, until today, when no articles will open. I've already deleted and reinstalled the app, to no avail.

I once subscribed to the Washington Post after them constantly begging for a subscription and only allowing me to read partial articles. Then they basically made it impossible for me to read them anyway. This app isn't that. Super easy to use. I've had it a week and I love it. You choose what interests you, they give you the headlines on your phone, you simply tap the headline, it takes you to a page where there's more in-depth headlines, another tap, and you're reading a well-written article.

Edit: Since the widgets disappeared several months ago, and the app has gotten buggy, I will be cancelling my subscription. After more than two months, the developers clearly have not listened to our requests and concerns, so I feel no need to keep paying for a product that I don't use, and is not user-friendly. The widget disappeared after my most recent update. That's what I largely use to review headlines and decide what I want to read. Beside that, the app is fine.

update: this has gone from bad to worse. i can't even open articles anymore. at least it used to just hang, crash and kill my battery. without question, the worst application I've ever seen. With most recent updates this is horrible. It uses a ton of battery, hangs for seconds at a time and will periodically start playing media at high volume. We will likely cancel our subscription if it doesn't get fixed fast as it's close to impossible to really read with this.

Still no scroll bar on the right side of articles, leaving no way to quickly assess article length or reading progress. This has been the case in the Android app, across many devices, for years. They fixed it for a month or two. Then it disappeared again. Additionally, they put out audio content available only through an iOS-only app.

Content good. App very bad. No way to stop the app from refreshing after every action. So you stop reading an article and come back later, and it refreshes and sends you to the top of current news, which forces you to locate the article again and find where you left off. If I really care enough about the content, I go through a browser search and read the article outside the app. Pop up ads frequently displace content making it impossible to read. Wirecutter log on simply does not work in app.

Paper itself is great. Notifications used to be great, but now only seem to pop up when I open the app (which turns into a barage of the last 24hrs worth of news). Also, most of the time I have to open the app twice before any articles load. This is especially annoying when trying to get to an article from a notification, which takes me to the "this article can not be found" page 99% of the time (and now the notification is gone so I've lost the direct link and have to hunt for the article).

Stories that I'm shown don't change very frequently. Frustrating their algorithm decides what stories I might want to read & only shows me those. "For You" section is worse. 80% of the articles are cooking articles. The NYT is right- I love cooking. But they require a separate subscription to their recipes and it angers me that almost all of the articles they are showing me are for recipes that I don't have access to see. Last, they send "news alerts" for non urgent articles I've already read.

Like the articles, hate the design. Several weeks ago, the progress bar disappeared on the articles. Turns out, some genius decided to make the progress bar white. A white progress bar on a white article doesn't show up. The whole purpose of that progress bar is to show where you are in the article. Until that is fixed, I will be an unhappy reader. (This is only a problem for Android phones, I should add.)

The app is horrible to use. Often links don't open the desired pages. You are then forced to look for them. But by far the worst thing is the constant refreshing of the main page, which turns white, tells you it is updating and waiting up to 30+ seconds or more before you can view another article. Sometimes the main page doesn't refresh completely, leaving you with a white page. Wouldn't be surprised that this doesn't happen on newer iOS devices!

I am constantly kicked out of reading to "restart the app." This happens several times within a 5 minute period and I get so frustrated I stop reading. I have tried the "provide feedback" option but have never received a reply despite including my email address (which is likely a marketing ploy). I have also written to Customer Service and nothing. When I called, it was suggested that I delete the app and reinstall. That didn't work either. Were this a free app -oh well, but it's not. If it's not addressed soon, The NYT will have one less digital subscriber and probably not miss me as much as I will miss the read. If I could afford the print addition, that's where I'd be!

Love the articles, obviously. For the app, it's easy to use and works consistently. My one criticism is that there appears to be a minor bug: When opening a link within the app, on the article that opens, the app sometimes does not have the three icons (bookmark/save, share, and "..." more) in the app header bar. Then there's no way to save for later or even get a URL so you can share the article.

Good for news, but has some problems. Two things are really annoying. The first is that you can't search the pages! I skimmed a story, then wanted to find some specifics... No Searching on the pages! The other annoying thing is that, while you can scroll through the articles, there is no scroll bar to show your progress... You can't tell if you're near the end or the beginning of a story, so you can't budget your time. When it gets to be too long, I just bail from the app.

Took away widgets - cancelling my subscription. I know there are other ways to use the app, but the widget was my way. I do not want email, I have more than enough podcasts and audio books already, and sometimes the alerts are just too much. Scrolling thru the widget wad casual and comfortable. I know it seems like a small change, but for me is a deal breaker.

Really am enamored with the articles and features that the NY Times presents... while I am reading these on my computer. Even though I am a paid subscriber (and have been for over a decade), I am continually frustrated by the app. Lately, it has been crashing frequently. I can no longer read Wirecutter because I cannot log in --- just see a white screen. Please fix this. A quality reading experience is what your subscribers expect and are paying for.

The constant pop-ups and redirects suggesting I subscribe are incredibly irritating because I am a subscriber and already logged in every time. I tried participating in a survey at the end of the article (I was looking for the comment section, no luck.) When I put the cursor in the text field the screen jumps up and down (best way I can describe it,) eliminating the ability to see the text as I type, then when I try to review it, I'm redirected to subscription ad again! Infuriating!

It updates news only sporadically - sometimes up to 24 hours in arrears. Their tech staff solutions didn't work - in fact, they suggested I look at it on the web instead. Oddly, the puzzles section is always up-to-date. So for late-breaking news, I go to my apps for the Washington Post, Guardian, BBC News, Reuters, AP, etc, but hey, if I want to do the Crossword, the NYT is there for me

About 75% of the time, clicking on a notification will only bring you to the homepage, not the specific story referenced in the notification. Very often that story is nowhere near the homepage, so you're left clumsily searching for it until you inevitably decide to just Google the event and read about it from a different source. If they could fix that, the app would be fine. Browsing stories looking for nothing in particular works well, but the notification system is absolutely broken.

I don't use it enough to even just justify having the app or paying for a subscription. But cancelling through the app was annoying. Not hard but annoying. It kept logging you out. The chat doesn't work. You don't have a keyboard to write. You can't see the texts. You have to call. That's just too much! That's absolutely pointless. How hard is it to make it a press of a button?

In general, it gives good news. HOWEVER, you literally need a subscription to do literally anything. You can't even read more than the headline on articles without subscribing. It's super inaccessible for people (like me) who just want good and accurate news but can't afford to get a $7 a month subscription which then goes to $16 a month after a year. This is a really big company, so I'm honestly shocked they charge THAT MUCH for a subscription so you can actually read the news.

Excellent reporting. Need to combine it with other news sources to get something more toward the center of the political aisle. Ok as an app. Notifications typically break - take you to the wrong article, mix up titles, or the link takes you back to the home screen. Has not been fixed long after a ticket was filed.

app is terrible! 1: can't zoom into images in article 2: bookmarked/save-for-later is shoved to corner. 3: the "for you" is not even based off MY saved for later articles. 4:my suggestion: put my bookmarks in the front, and simply offer related stuff along it. 5:thoughts: basically shoves everything your not interested in in from of you, rather than let you continue what you want to read and discover more. I'm just staying with the web version, at least you can zoom into the images.

I do not care about sports. Could not possibly be less interested. You cannot turn off notifications for sports related news. Now, there is a setting to make you believe they are turned off, but it's a facade. Even with it off, the notifications still come, bombarding your notification panel a dozen plus times a day with stories like how the bronze medalist olympic ribbon twirler from 1962 stubbed their toe and missed try outs. Then, the app has the audacity to randomly turn the setting back on

I've been a NYT subscriber on the Kindle for more than a decade, but now forced onto the app, which is a big step down. For the same price, the Kindle edition was ad-free. The Kindle edition also had basic functionality like "how far through the article am I?" and "goto next article". The app is much much worse than the Kindle edition.

The new version of the app often fails to load articles, and is missing a scroll bar, making the article length a secret. I need the scroll bar to manage my time while reading. Now the only way to see how long an article is is to scroll to the bottom -- conveniently forcing me to see all the ads. This feels like a cynical attempt to increase ad clicks, and is insulting for a paid subscription. I really hope this is not the future of journalism.

Absolutely LOVE reading this newspaper. However, recently it seems very buggy! Only about half of an article loads and the rest of the screen is black. When I go back and pick a new article it doesn't even load. It has nothing to do with internet connection because I have a good connection. As a paying subscriber this is disappointing...please fix quickly!

This app desperately needs a home button. It's frustrating to have to click back through a lot of articles after having read them just to get back to the front headlines page. Also the background downloading of articles generally doesn't work. There have been plenty of times when I've been on flights with no WiFi and when I open this app only a paltry few if any articles have been downloaded for offline reading. Even if it were to work there's no option to download only when on a charger.

The app is slow and a pain to use. Sometimes you click on an article, only to find that it's part of a list of headlines around a topic and you've been taken to the top of the list, only to scroll down back to the one you clicked on to start. I get multiple notifications for articles I've already read. Lately it just takes forever to load anything.

Updated as usability is rapidly going down the drain. The three major faults I see are how stories are loaded (2 issues) and the lack of dark mode. The app loads ads in the middle of reading articles. It then jumps to the ads (that I've never clicked through intentionally) and you loose your position and have to find it again - annoying as hrll!. Many of the articles aren't downloaded until you click on them - doesn't work on the NY subway, duh! Get working on dark mode!

I should have read the reviews before I updated, which I did because certain sections weren't loading well. But the new format is horrible! The top scroll bar that had been customized to my interests is gone. I'm not sure why, since I could easily find other sections in the pull out on the left if I wanted to read them. Now, all the sections are accessed from a button on the bottom right and all jumbled together. For example, I never read sports, but have to scroll past it to get topics I want.

Can no longer change font size. 'Saved for Later' works for ~50% of the articles unless you go into each one and then exit. Saved articles don't load when there's no service unless you put the phone in airplane mode. But to its credit, saved articles are saved online so you can read them from multiple devices and they survive a phone failure

Great organization, but the notifications do not link to the referenced article. In fact, many of the notification topics can't even be found via search in the app (perhaps too soon to be indexed?). Please do what others do, like wapo, and provide a section of recently received notifications in the app. 6 month update: This is still not addressed. I left feedback in the app and they told me they were working on it months ago, yet still no progress.

Update 7/8/20 - the app can't sustain itself for even 5 minutes. Can't even read 1 article before it stops working. Cancelling the subscription. _---------_ On a pixel and the app has started crashing very frequently. It occurs when I've been in the app for more than a few minutes. Might be because the auto refresh of news and scrolling can't be handled by the app.

title: Tumblr - Social Media & Art
description:
Welcome to Tumblr, your ultimate creative space and social media community for art, memes, and fandoms. Whether you're deep into a niche or just discovering your artistic side, Tumblr welcomes every voice and vision. It’s where creativity, community, and self-expression come together in one powerful platform. Share your work, connect with fans, and explore endless opportunities to post your art in a supportive art community.

Use Tumblr to share art, write an art blog, discover new fandoms, and explore your interests without limits. Post images, text, videos, GIFs, and even audio to your own personalized dashboard. Follow topics you love, reblog content that inspires you, and build your own art community of fans and friends. Post your art alongside like-minded creators, whether you’re into illustrations, photography, or fanart.

Tumblr is your creative playground. Whether you’re into digital art, fanfiction, cosplay, or simply love funny memes, you’ll find others who get it. Express yourself with GIFs, memes, fanart, and tutorials, and join authentic conversations with others who share your passions across countless fandoms. Think of this as your space to be real, hang out, and create openly.

Our social media platform supports original content creation, art blogs, and fan communities. Use tags to reach new audiences and curate your personal feed. Whether you're writing original stories, sharing digital art, or posting your latest fan creations, your dashboard is where it all comes together. Post your art with ease and connect with people who share your interests in an engaged art community that supports your creativity.

Explore trending tags, join creative challenges, or browse through curated art collections and fan edits. Discover the latest in K-pop, anime, Marvel, DC, gaming, and TV show fandoms. Tumblr thrives on vibrant spaces, giving you access to a world of niche interests and major trends. You can even follow your favorite fic writers from AO3 (Archive of Our Own), see their OC art, and share your passions in conversations about your favorite fanfiction universes.

Start your own webcomic, showcase your fan creations, or simply enjoy scrolling through an endless stream of content. With tools for reblogging, liking, and sharing, you’re never far from discovering something amazing. Join the community where you can hang out, reblog iconic moments, engage in fan theories, or just scroll for inspiration. Be real and express your unique style while being yourself in creative communities across a global art network.

Customize your experience with our intuitive tools and privacy settings. Create multiple blogs, go private, or make a name for yourself in the digital art and fanart world. Whether you’re here to share your voice, find your people, or simply enjoy the internet the way it used to be, Tumblr is your space to do it all. Post your art or write your next art blog, and discover a community where everyone can be real.

 Download Tumblr now and become part of a global creative social media community. From art sharing apps and fandom hubs to social creativity tools and online self-expression, this is your space to belong. Explore creative discussions, connect with an art community, and make it your own.

Twitter: https://twitter.com/tumblr/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/tumblr/
Terms of Service: https://www.tumblr.com/policy/terms-of-service

summary: Dive into diverse fandoms. Connect, create, reblog.

scraped_reviews.content: Yet another update, and more glitching and bugs. Now it doesn't always send notifications when I get messages. Also now everytime I log in I have to go through and change my settings again and again. The app will freeze after a couple minutes and close whatever blog you're looking at and either reload and take me to home screen or it just closes out. The app has been getting worse lately, not better after the updates. this company really needs to find some talented developers
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please contact Tumblr Support at https://tumblr.com/support for assistance. Thanks!

scraped_reviews.content: The ads have gotten worse since last year, and are more aggressive. The worse ones are the ones that are flashy and overly animated, like the casino ones. I find them triggering as well. I'm uninstalling the app and using it through the browser instead. I liked the app, but I couldn't deal with the ads. Plus they slow down your phone.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please report the ad(s) to our advertising team by following these steps: https://help.tumblr.com/knowledge-base/tumblr-ads-you/

scraped_reviews.content: I've had this app on every phone I've owned since 2014 and I haven't had it freeze and glitch before. I'll be scrolling and the screen will start shaking, images/gifs/videos will start freaking out, and random letters in text will disappear before the app crashes and closes itself. I've uninstalled, wiped all tumblr related data, and re-downloaded, but to no avail. Haven't been able to use the app for more than a few minutes at a time for over a year.

The app is incredibly buggy and glitchy. There used to be maybe one ad every 10-20 posts, now it's every third post and it's the same ad over and over. Search functions are wacked, mobile has less freedom than web (ex. Only 10 photos per post on mobile, up to 30 on web). It really sucks that this app's functionality is so bad, because it's really the only social media I can really tailor to what content I want to or don't want to see.

Getting inconsistent notifications for DMs is infuriating. I'm not one to ignore my friends, so it would be nice if the app did its very simple job and notified me when I get a message. Sometimes it does, but it fails to send a push notification when a DM is received far, FAR too often for my liking. I've checked both settings in my phone and the app, too, so I know this isn't my fault. Edit: dropping this to one star, not even support has answered this one for me

Hey uh. There's something wrong with Tumblr. I'm getting ads literally everywhere I turn. You'd think that I can scroll away from them but uh. They cover the whole screen, the exit button doesn't work, and the whole thing is shaky as hell. I can't even get to the search bar without this happening let alone other people's profiles. I'm completely unable to use the app. Please fix this as soon as you can
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for letting us know! We're currently investigating. Please report the ad(s) to our advertising team by following these steps: https://help.tumblr.com/knowledge-base/tumblr-ads-you/

scraped_reviews.content: an ad for a car dealership is auto full-screening when i open the app. the x in the corner does nothing. really really cool. you may be thinking, "well they want ads to be annoying so you pay to get rid of them!" but no, im not giving them a single cent! their app has been barely functional for years now, with new issues arising every few months (usually regarding incredibly intrusive ads), im not rewarding that! id rather drop the platform altogether to be honest!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for letting us know about this! We're currently looking into it. Please report the ad(s) to our advertising team by following these steps: https://help.tumblr.com/knowledge-base/tumblr-ads-you/

scraped_reviews.content: Love Tumblr as a site, but the newest update, specifically the removal of the quick queue button has made the app borderline unusable for me. What used to be a single input is now 5 separate clicks for the same thing. I have no idea why they would do this, and if it doesn't go back to the way it was I'm gonna change to some other social media site. Also, have been getting lots of ads featuring gore and straight up porn lately that I don't want to see, and reporting the ads seems to do nothing.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback, we appreciate it! We regularly collect suggestions and feedback to our development teams. And while we may not implement all suggestions, the discussion around them is what drives us to make great things.

scraped_reviews.content: I've been a tumblr user since 2011 and I've been using the app for pretty much as long as it has existed. The ads within the past year or so have become so intrusive it is unbearable. Previously it was banner ads that would open a pop-up in my browser, now I randomly get a full-screen ad which I cannot exit out of and have to close the entire app to dismiss. I don't know why the current devs are trying so hard to drive users away, but it's working.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please report the ad(s) to our advertising team by following these steps: https://help.tumblr.com/knowledge-base/tumblr-ads-you/

scraped_reviews.content: this used to be one of my favorites... nowadays i have to resort to using the browser version to get anything done. the mobile version is almost unusable. even with all autoplays and extra motions disabled, the app is so insanely laggy and slow (and at times unresponsive) to the point where i have to exit and go back into the app every few minutes to "reset" it... and oh my days, the amount of times the app crashes after doing the bare minimum... very frustrating as a long-time user :/
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Our team is investigating the cause. Please contact Tumblr Support at https://tumblr.com/support

scraped_reviews.content: Love Tumblr and have been using it for a long time, and I predominately use it on my phone. But since earlier this month almost any time I use the app for more than like fifteen minutes it slows down rapidly and eventually makes me have to close out the app and re-open it. This plus the tendency for it to randomly shoot me up to the top of whichever tag I'm scrolling through- Has become an aggravating and annoying nuisance.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please contact Tumblr Support at https://tumblr.com/support

scraped_reviews.content: Staff doesn't listen to the users about what would actually be good, and every update breaks something. Most recently the app formatting broke; you have to open your blog in web if you want to change anything in account settings because the options are hidden under the bar across the top. Users are mostly okay though. Aside from the scam and spam bots that run rampant.

Borderline unusable. my app is fully updated, my phone can handle intensive apps, but for some reason without fail my phone lags so much on the tumblr app that I'm getting at best 3fps. this has happened on my past 3 phones, but androids and iphones. I clear the cache, I don't let videos or gifs autoplay, and I still can barely use the app. I'm seriously considering just deleting it entirely.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please contact Tumblr Support at https://tumblr.com/support

scraped_reviews.content: I don't even know how long I've been on Tumblr. I found some fantastic communities and I love getting to support artists but this past year the app freezes, glitches, and slows down MY ENTIRE PHONE. I can't tell you how many times I've restarted my phone thinking it was defective and it was tumblr somehow running in the background. DO NOT DOWNLOAD THIS APP. Developers and staff don't listen to users, its over-run with ads and AI now. Just use it on your web browser if you can't let it go like me

I'm fairly certain a recent update has caused the Tumblr mobile app to absolutely destroy my brand new phone's processing speed. It freezes, glitches, crashes, and slows down every single day, multiple times a day, and slows down and glitches my phone even if it isn't open and is just running in the background. Idk if its the ads, the ai scanning content, or what but its infuriating.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please contact Tumblr Support at https://tumblr.com/support

scraped_reviews.content: Listen. I do like this app, but enough is enough. By no fault of their own, they're understaffed and in need of money. I get that. But at some point, in app ad reporting & service emails about their app crashing my phone, that end in bandaid fixes, no longer cut it. I'm posting after yet another crash that had my phone fully dead for 5 minutes. I'll deal with the messy desktop version over an app that almost killed my phone. It's not with the cost of a new phone.

I don't know what changed with the recent Tumblr mobile update, but now almost every time I open the app my phone lags and nearly crashes even after closing the app. Closing and reopening the app does not fix this, nor does restarting my phone, and it's gotten to the point that the entire app has become unusable. I genuinely have no idea why this is happening after what appeared to be just a UI change. Just use the web browser version, mobile isn't worth the trouble.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please contact Tumblr Support at https://tumblr.com/support

scraped_reviews.content: I love the app, I do, I've had it since high school BUT it's been lagging and randomly opening to an ad through my browser. I thought it was my phone in general, so I've been deleting apps and clearing my phones cache, but it still lags and opens random "ads". I really don't want to have to delete this app, but if it still acts up like this, then deleting it might be the answer.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please contact Tumblr Support at https://tumblr.com/support

scraped_reviews.content: For the last few months, the app just completely overheats and crashes my phone the moment it tries to load a video or gif :( I can get maybe four minutes on a good day, and then response time for any screen input drops to 10-30 seconds until I can quit the app entirely. It makes it extremely difficult to interact with anything or enjoy time on the app, which is such a shame since Tumblr is the only social media that I still enjoy using. Please please fix the Android app! (using oneui 8)
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please contact Tumblr Support at https://tumblr.com/support

scraped_reviews.content: Stick to browser because the app freezes, blasts ads at full volume (that you can't turn off without paying), and it will overheat your phone in less than a minute. Edit: 9/21/25 Ads are aggressive, and they autoplay. Reporting the ads does nothing but push it behind the posts as your scrolling, so you can report them anymore. The app is slow, buggy, and continues to overheat devices to temperatures that burn my hands.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for the review! Please contact Tumblr Support at https://tumblr.com/support for assistance. Thanks!

scraped_reviews.content: newest update immediately makes my phone lag and freeze extremely frequently, even if the app is just open in the background. it's completely unusable at the moment. before this update it seemed like certain ads were causing freezes, but now it's happening no matter what. based on other recent reviews, i'm not the only person with this problem.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please contact Tumblr Support at https://tumblr.com/support

scraped_reviews.content: i've been getting nothing but the same exact ad every two or three posts for well over a week now. i just refreshed my app and decided to count how many times i saw it in a row. 27. TWENTY SEVEN TIMES. i wish i was joking. i've been marking it as 'see this ad too often' every single time i see it and can confirm the feature is pointless lol. i get y'all need ads to keep the app free but you couldn't be more obnoxious about it. literally makes me not want to use the app
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please contact Tumblr Support with a screenshot of the ad at https://tumblr.com/support

scraped_reviews.content: Can we please stop adding clutter to the bottom menu, or at least add an option to customize which tabs you want (dashboard, search, messages, etc.)? Six different tabs is too much for an already bloated UI. The ads are also getting to be way too much, between the flashing lights, ads under ever two or so posts, and ads that randomly click off to a web page. Something needs to be done to clean up the app, stat.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please report the ad(s) to our advertising team by following these steps: https://help.tumblr.com/knowledge-base/tumblr-ads-you/

scraped_reviews.content: The app won't l9ad a thing for me lately. Its not my wifi, I've tested it several times. All other apps load just fine, including photos videos, and gifs. For some reason, tumblr on mobile won't load anything - even when I try to open it in my mobile browser app. This has been happening for at least a week now and I'm getting tired of not being able to use the app. On my laptop everything loads just fine, so its only the mobile versions that are having issues.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please contact Tumblr Support at https://tumblr.com/support

scraped_reviews.content: my experience so far is so-so. can't navigate through the menu and number direct me to where I want to go pretty sure I'm not getting my notifications according to my emails when I go to find them and treat them in order to be found I'm having a really rough time with the app finding a navigating through it and trying to figure it out it's just frustrating to me. plus someone I know said they didn't have to pay to be a member and they said this year is when they started I'm confused because I pa
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please contact Tumblr Support at https://tumblr.com/support

scraped_reviews.content: while I prefer to browse on my phone, lately the app has been fully crashing my entire phone system at random. sometimes it's when I boot up the app, sometimes its after minutes of scrolling, but it always freezes the entire phone, my lock button doesn't even function when it happens. no other apps do this. Tumblr what the hell.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please contact Tumblr Support at https://tumblr.com/support

scraped_reviews.content: Best social media site, terribly held together as an app. Stop letting ads break your own product, can't listen to music because ads pause any music background all even though they don't play sound. I'm going to pick my music over your app 10 out of 10 times. edit: 2 weeks later of non-stop reporting the same ad for auto-playing media and Tumblr still hasn't done anything. Certified hellsite.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please contact Tumblr Support at https://tumblr.com/support

scraped_reviews.content: So many little issues. Notifications that don't clear when you've seen them, two accounts somehow have the same inbox, ads in odd places, the list goes on. update 10/27/25: Sometimes it works normally and sometimes it freezes and sometimes it crashes so hard it gives my phone a damn seizure. Seriously considering deleting this app.

An update and its broken tumblr - and not in a good way. every time I get a notification from a blog i have notifications/alerts turned on for I'll tap to look at it and try and go to their profile by tapping on their username and it freezes. I have to close the app, open it again, search up their username just to view their blog. AND sometimes when im scrolling through my dash and want to view the original poster's blog instead of who reblogged it, it'll just send me to who reblogged it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please contact Tumblr Support at https://tumblr.com/support

scraped_reviews.content: I had subscribed to the no ads app for the last couple of years because it was abou 35 bucks and that was fine over the course of 12 months. Now it just randomly doubled the cost to add a bunch of "features" that I be to interest in using. I don't need it want to "blaze" a post. All I want is NO ADS! Give us a lower tier subscription for JUST no ads.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback, we appreciate it! We’ll be sharing your thoughts with our development team. If you’d like to start a conversation with us and the wider Tumblr community around your ideas, you can now send us an ask or submission on https://www.tumblr.com/wip

scraped_reviews.content: The dashboard often doesn't load any posts, and when it does, it loads about 3 before ending. If you search tags, it shows nothing but the same posts over and over again. I used to love tumblr, but the app is not really functional right now. Not sure what happened behind the scenes, but I really miss the community. It would be really nice to have a functioning app.

For the past week, my phone has been randomly opening pages to game sites. I thought I had unintentionally downloaded an adware or other malicious app. Turns out that this only happens while I browse Tumblr. I don't even see an ad regarding the games, but it will suddenly interrupt my scrolling to open a games site page in my browser. This has happened at least once a day since the 13th. I nearly reset my phone thinking it was compromised.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please contact Tumblr Support at https://www.tumblr.com/support

scraped_reviews.content: Really wish instead of new features no one asked for we could get the bots and scams dealt with. EDIT: my account was terminated with zero notice. I'd never gotten in trouble for anything. My sideblogs are still up but I have no way to access them. Hoping support will do something. Extremely frustrating to get booted with no warning after using the site for almost a decade.

So yeah sorry man, the app is.....non-functional, to be blunt. Constant crashes, frequently drags you from where you're scrolling to randomly bring you back to the very top of the page/results, and god forbid you try to expand a post when the app has decided you've had it easy for too long. The rest of the app is generally fine, but it's completely unusable. I downloaded it like what, three days ago? and I'm already uninstalling. I'm just gonna use the website.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please contact Tumblr Support at https://tumblr.com/support

scraped_reviews.content: this app has always been bad and will always be bad, which is saying something considering Tumblr on desktop is unusable without at least one extension if not multiple. but now they've added fullscreen pop up ads that don't go away unless you close the app, which are, of course, the same scammy fake stuff that Tumblr ads have always been. this app was already garbage but now it's bad enough that I'm going back to using it in a mobile browser (which also sucks, if that's not obvious).

so before the recent update if you were reading a post the end of the post was the end of the 'page' and you could select to click on a new recommend post from a cluster of images/posts. now however its just continuous scrolling which is terrible. not only can i not see how much longer i have to read something based on the scroll bar but i also cant choose the next post and have to read whatever order it generates. please put it back!

Great app with a solid algorithm, and one of those rare cases where the ads don't interfere with your viewing experience— but this recent development spamming notifications needs to stop. I don't need to know every time a user I follow interacts with someone else. The filtering system could also use some work— posts with marked hashtags should be excluded entirely from search, not just have a warning attached to it.

app is good. however, I'm not sure why but the android chrome version (where I often find myself when clicking links from other apps or other sites) seems to have trouble directing to the app when I try to heart a specific post, and instead directs to the app store page rather than taking me directly to the post on the Tumblr app. pressing "open in app" on the upper right of an account page seems to work fine though.

Recently started playing this country sounding music that I thought was from an ad shortly after I open the app. Doesn't matter if I scroll or go to search for something, it will randomly start playing. Also, in search, when I hit X to delete a search, I have to back out of search and then go back in for it to be gone. I could be hitting the same X button repeatedly, but it doesn't disappear until I leave the search or just close the app.

Uninstalled, reinstalled, uninstalled, reinstalled and still can't log in or make it work on wifi. But when on Data, everything works. Seems I'm not the only 1 experiencing this. How stupid can this be? Supposedly been a issue for months and yet Tumblr, you can't or won't do anything until everyone is experiencing this issue? Whoever heard of an app that will only work over cellular data and then becomes useless over wifi at home, office etc? Stupid as stupid can be!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Please contact us at tumblr.com/support about this.

scraped_reviews.content: my experience with the app has been really good up until recently, for whatever reason now, it just lags and crashes every 2 to 5 minutes. which makes it almost unusable, i've cleared my data on the app and tried to see if that would make it run smoother but that didn't even work?? hope this can be fixed soon because it's genuinely frustrating to deal with.

Ads clearly random AI images. I keep getting sexual ads when I'm pretty sure sexual content isn't even supposed to be allowed. Keeps crashing after about 2 minutes of use. I tried to look at notes of a post and it crashed. Has actually restarted my phone with the crashing. It's literally not a usable app.

The app refreshes every time I go out of it or put my phone to sleep for a minute. Any other app I can leave and return to the same spot I left off, but not Tumblr. Given the way the app functions, the constant background refreshing that won't stop even when I turn off background processes is making the app unusable.

Gotten better over time. I've had minimal recent issues other than the fact that when I change passwords on a blog, it doesn't automatically log me out. And when I go to log out, I get stuck on a perpetual loading screen. I end up just having to uninstall, reinstall.

Cool app and all but like twice a week it just breaks. The scrolling freezes and skips and glitches in ways that could give someone a seizure. Oftentimes the video ads trigger it and it just gets worse with each one. The ones that stick to the top of the screen are the worst about this.

The new buttons are quite literally ugly and ruin the whole UI. I do not think I will continue to use the mobile app, as they suck and ruin the "vibe". They're too large, they do not fit with the rest of the posts, the colour and shapes are off and unpleasant. They are quite the darn eyesore. Will be deleting the mobile app, and perhaps even the desktop version if the changes follow.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback, we appreciate it! We regularly collect suggestions and feedback to our development teams. And while we may not implement all suggestions, the discussion around them is what drives us to make great things.

scraped_reviews.content: The ads on this app is bigger than the user base. The fact that the ads take up the entire screen whenever I scroll is absolutely infuriating that I tend to only spend 5 mins on the app only to leave. Added that every 3 post you'll scroll through an ad banner will appear to take up your screen. Horrible experience all around, wouldn't recommend this app at all.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for surfacing this issue. Please report the ad(s) to our advertising team by following these steps: https://help.tumblr.com/knowledge-base/tumblr-ads-you/

scraped_reviews.content: The interface has improved a lot. The app is old and you'll have to deliberately block some inappropriate stuff from time to time, but the community is awesome when you find people who respect each other. It's a great place to make friends with the same interests as you, especially in art, and to follow the work of creative people. I regard it as a cosy and calmer social network than others I'm not sure I can mention, where people tend to be more rude.

i love this app alot I use it basically every day and have collected a decent group of people who like my writing on there as well as friends only issue i have is that as someone who doesn't write in tumblr and uses an alternative app it becomes quite an issue when I have to copy and paste the entire story especially when I have a corrected version of the chapter. my only question is if it could become possible to copy the text of a post easier for this reason.

Tumblr has been a home, a refuge, a space for free expression for many years. It is still the only place relatively (or entirely?, I don't know exactly) independent and it does not use the algorithm most social media apps use. However, I'm giving it 4 stars because reports need to be taken more seriously, and a few features could improve, particularly community roles.

title: Citi Mobile®
description:
Simpler
All Mobile Account*: Open a checking or savings account right from the app without setting foot in a bank branch
Fast Navigation: Quickly get to your favorite features with an intuitive navigation menu and smart shortcuts 
Card Replacement: Request a new card if your original is lost, stolen or damaged
Citi Mobile® Snapshot: Quickly review key account info – without having to sign in every time
Zelle®: A fast, fee-free way within the Citi Mobile App to pay and easily split payments with people you trust.**  
Mobile Check Deposit: Quickly and easily deposit checks from your mobile device
Find an ATM: Easily locate one of more than 60,000 fee-free ATMs in the U.S near you
Account Information: View your statements, check balances and recent activity 
Make same-day or scheduled payments easily

Smarter 
Aggregation*: Link virtually all your bank accounts, credit cards and investment accounts for a more holistic financial view to managing your finances
Spending insights*: Track your spending habits and trends across your accounts 
Bill management*: View and manage your bills, and recurring payments in one place
FICO® Score : Citi credit card customers can view their FICO® Score for free 
Make payments including automatic payments, and transfers and manage payees
Dispute credit card transactions if ever needed and track the status
Stay informed with Account Alerts: Choose the alerts you want and even when you want them
Change your credit card due date: Choose the beginning, middle, or end of a month
Secure 
Citi® Quick Lock: Lock or unlock your lost or misplaced card 
PIN Reset: Reset your debit card PIN from your mobile device
Enable Fingerprint Authentication for a fast way to access your account
* Features are available today on a limited basis.

**Zelle and the Zelle related marks are wholly owned by Early Warning Services, LLC and are used herein under license.

Citi’s Mobile App has been certified by J.D. Power for providing “An Outstanding Mobile Credit Card Experience” for customers.”
J.D. Power 2019 Mobile App Certification Program recognition is based on successful completion of an audit and exceeding a customer experience benchmark through a survey of recent servicing interactions. For more information, visit jdpower.com/awards.

Your trust and confidence in how we collect, use, and share information about you is a priority. Review our privacy notice at  https://online.citi.com/JRS/portal/template.do?ID=Privacy and our notice at collection at https://online.citi.com/JRS/portal/template.do?ID=Privacy#notice-at-collection to learn more about privacy at Citi. Additionally, California residents may submit requests in connection with the California Consumer Privacy Act at https://online.citi.com/dataprivacyhub
